examples: they arrived at an awkward time

results.definition: lacking grace or skill in manner or movement or performance
examples: too awkward with a needle to make her own clothes
his clumsy fingers produced an awkward knot

results.definition: difficult to handle or manage especially because of shape
examples: the cello, a rather ungainly instrument for a girl

results.definition: not elegant or graceful in expression
examples: if the rumor is true, can anything be more inept than to repeat it now?

results.definition: hard to deal with; especially causing pain or embarrassment
examples: awkward (or embarrassing or difficult) moments in the discussion
an awkward pause followed his remark
in the unenviable position of resorting to an act he had planned to save for the climax of the campaign

results.definition: socially uncomfortable; unsure and constrained in manner
examples: ill at ease among eddies of people he didn't know
